item.title: 2024 年美国招聘引擎持续运转，新增 220 万个工作岗位
item.description: 2024 年，美国经济增加了 220 万个就业岗位，虽然比上一年有所放缓，但仍是一个显著的恢复迹象，这在 12 个月前是很少有专家预料到的。【原文：The US economy added 2.2 million jobs in 2024, a slowdown from the previous year but still a remarkable sign of resilience that few pundits had expected twelve months earlier.】

item.title: 一张图解释利率的大幅波动
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 美国银行、花旗银行因就业数据而对美联储降息失去信心
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）和花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：Economists at Bank of America Corp. and Citigroup Inc. revised their forecasts for additional Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts in response to stronger-than-expected December US employment data released Friday.】

item.title: 拜登告别时制裁俄罗斯石油为何意义重大
item.description: 就在乔-拜登离开白宫、由唐纳德-特朗普接任总统的十天前，美国周五宣布对俄罗斯的石油贸易实施迄今为止最全面、最严厉的制裁。【原文：The US on Friday announced the most sweeping and aggressive sanctions yet on Russia’s oil trade, just ten days before Joe Biden leaves the White House to be replaced by Donald Trump as president.】

item.title: 天堂被毁：大火夷平了洛杉矶比曼哈顿还大的飞地
item.description:
太平洋帕利塞德大火已对 5,000 多座建筑造成严重破坏，在大火熄灭后的很长一段时间内，它都将重塑洛杉矶的面貌。【原文：

The Pacific Palisades blaze has wreaked havoc on over 5,000 structures and is set to reshape Los Angeles long after it burns out.

】

item.title: 美联储古尔斯比称就业数据显示劳动力市场趋于稳定
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）说，最新的就业报告表明，劳动力市场正稳定在充分就业的水平上，并不是经济过热的迹象。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee said the latest jobs report suggests the labor market is stabilizing at full employment and is not a sign of an overheating economy.】

item.title: 罗马尼亚审查匈牙利购买公用事业的安全风险
item.description: 罗马尼亚正在审查一家匈牙利国有企业收购一家能源公司的计划是否会带来安全风险。【原文：Romania is reviewing whether a Hungarian state-owned company’s plan to purchase an energy utility poses a security risk.】

item.title: 加拿大外长乔利不会参加接替特鲁多的竞选
item.description: 加拿大外交部长梅拉妮-乔利（Melanie Joly）表示，她不会参加接替贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）担任总理的领导层竞选。【原文：Canadian Foreign Affairs Minister Melanie Joly said she won’t enter the leadership race to succeed Justin Trudeau as prime minister.】

item.title: 埃尔-埃里安说：债券大跌暴露了市场的 "脆弱性
item.description: 穆罕默德-埃尔-埃里安（Mohamed El-Erian）认为，有弹性的劳动力市场预示着美国正在引领全球经济，而高企的美国债券收益率则给英国等其他国家带来了压力。【原文：A resilient labor market signals the US is leading the global economy, and high US bond yields put pressure on others like the UK, according to Mohamed El-Erian.】

item.title: 埃塞俄比亚开设证券交易所，只有一家上市公司，没有经纪人
item.description: 埃塞俄比亚在没有任何经纪人和首次公开募股的情况下开设了证券交易所，这是为吸引投资者进入从内战中恢复的经济而实施的计划的一部分。【原文：Ethiopia opened its stock exchange — part of a plan to lure investors to an economy recovering from a civil war — without any brokers and no initial public offering debuts.】

item.title: 融创表示不排除第二次海外债务重组的可能性
item.description: 违约的房地产开发商融创中国控股有限公司（Sunac China Holdings Ltd.）表示，不排除进行第二次境外债务重组的可能，因为长期的房地产危机使其前景黯淡，而且它还面临着另一份要求结束业务的法院申请。【原文：Defaulted property developer Sunac China Holdings Ltd. said it can’t rule out a second offshore debt restructuring as a prolonged property crisis dims its outlook and it faces another court petition to wind up operations.】

item.title: 美国消费者通胀预期跃升至 2008 年以来最高点
item.description: 由于担心即将上任的特朗普政府可能征收关税，美国消费者的长期通胀预期跃升至 2008 年以来的最高点。【原文：US consumers’ long-term inflation expectations jumped to the highest since 2008 on concerns about potential tariffs from the incoming Trump administration.】

item.title: 兰特跌破 19，美元因美国就业数据走强
item.description: 在美国就业数据远超预期之后，南非兰特兑美元汇率跌至九个月来的最弱水平，这进一步证明南非的利率可能会在更长时间内保持较高水平。【原文：South Africa’s rand plunged to the weakest level in nine months against the dollar after US jobs data came in far stronger than expected, more evidence that interest rates there could stay higher for longer.】

item.title: 国内生产总值下滑风波后，南非将整理更多农业数据
item.description: 南非将开始提供有关农业部门业绩的高频数据，此前第三季度农业部门出现了令人震惊的萎缩，使政府的增长预测岌岌可危，并导致该国最大的农业游说团体委托进行调查。【原文：South Africa will start providing high frequency data on the agriculture sector’s performance after a shock third quarter contraction in the industry put the government’s growth projection in jeopardy and led the country’s biggest farm-industry lobbies to commission a probe.】

item.title: 洛杉矶野火最新消息
item.description: 1 月 9 日，在加利福尼亚州马里布的 Palisades 大火中，消防员用水管冲洗太平洋海岸公路上一座正在燃烧的建筑物。摄影师：吉尔-康奈利/布鲁姆伯格【原文：Firefighters hose down a smoldering building on the Pacific Coast Highway during the Palisades Fire in Malibu, California, on Jan. 9. Photographer: Jill Connelly/Bloomberg】

item.title: 布伦特原油自 10 月以来首次达到每桶 80 美元
item.description: 据报道，印度石油加工商正在为美国的新制裁做准备，这将打击来自俄罗斯的石油供应。【原文：Oil surpassed $80 a barrel as traders digested a report that Indian oil processors are bracing for new US sanctions that would hit flows from Russia.】

item.title: 美国最高法院权衡有关 TikTok 禁令的争论
item.description: 一位游客在华盛顿特区最高法院拍照留念。摄影师：Stefani Reynolds/Bloomberg【原文：A visitor takes a photograph of the Supreme Court in Washington, DC. Photographer: Stefani Reynolds/Bloomberg】

item.title: 澳元创 2020 年以来最低，美元受美国数据影响大涨
item.description: 澳元跌至2020年4月以来的最低点，原因是美国就业报告热度超过预期，导致交易员大幅下调美联储今年降息的预期步伐，澳元因此飙升。【原文：Australia’s dollar slid to the lowest since April 2020 as the greenback surged following a hotter-than-expected US jobs report that led traders to sharply dial back the expected pace of Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts this year.】

item.title: 可可结束波动周，好时竞相大举收购
item.description: 巧克力制造商好时公司（Hershey Co.【原文：Cocoa headed for a weekly decline in New York, after a volatile few days that included chocolate maker Hershey Co.’s bid to source a huge amount of beans through the exchange.】

item.title: 进口量下降，德国成本高昂的液化天然气接收站未见成效
item.description: 为确保能源安全，德国斥巨资建造了液化天然气终端，但高昂的使用成本意味着这些终端只能满足德国对天然气的极小部分需求。【原文：Germany spent big on liquefied natural gas terminals to ensure energy security, but the high cost of using them means they’re bringing in a tiny fraction of its gas needs.】

item.title: 土耳其央行对市场利率前景持谨慎态度
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，土耳其央行的一位高级官员告诉银行家们，降息的步伐将根据通货膨胀的进程而定，这与市场对大幅、连续降息的预期背道而驰。【原文：A top Turkish central bank official told bankers that the pace of interest-rate cuts will be based on the course of inflation, pushing back against market expectations for sizable, consecutive reductions, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 加州禁止取消洛杉矶火灾灾区的保险合同
item.description: 加利福尼亚州禁止保险公司取消或不再续订洛杉矶受大火影响地区的住宅财产保险，大火本周摧毁了该市的大片地区。【原文：California banned insurers from canceling or not renewing residential property policies in the Los Angeles neighborhoods that were affected by the blazes that destroyed swaths of the city this week.】

item.title: 交易员推迟美联储下次降息，美国 30 年期收益率触及 5
item.description: 美国国债大跌，原因是劳动力市场复苏的证据促使交易商将对美联储下一次降息的预期转移到下半年。【原文：US Treasuries plunged as evidence of a resilient labor market pushed traders to shift their expectations for the Federal Reserve’s next interest-rate cut to the second half of the year.】

item.title: 美国 12 月就业数据强劲，黄金涨势减弱
item.description: 由于美国就业报告强于预期，美元和国债收益率走高，黄金收窄涨幅。【原文：Gold pared gains as the dollar and Treasury yields pushed higher following a stronger-than-expected US jobs report.】

item.title: 美国薪资增长加快，失业率下降
item.description: 美国经济在 12 月份增加了自 3 月份以来最多的就业岗位，失业率意外下降，为今年出人意料的强劲表现画上了句号，也为美联储暂停降息提供了支持。【原文：The US economy in December added the most jobs since March and the unemployment rate unexpectedly fell, capping a surprisingly strong year and supporting the case for a pause in Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 加拿大新增 91,000 个就业岗位，失业率降至 6.7
item.description: 在加拿大经济有可能陷入与美国的关税战之前，加拿大两年来最大的就业增长为 2024 年画上了圆满的句号。【原文：Canada’s biggest job gains in two years capped off 2024 on a high note before the economy is potentially thrown into a tariff war with the US.】

item.title: 贝宁希望通过出售美元债券获得 7.5 亿美元的预算资金
item.description: 据熟悉该交易的人士透露，贝宁希望通过出售美元债券筹集 7.5 亿美元，与去年的筹资额持平，成为 2025 年第一个进入国际债务市场的非洲借款国。【原文：Benin is looking to raise $750 million through its sale of dollar bonds, according to people familiar with the deal, matching the amount it raised last year as it becomes the first African borrower to tap international debt markets in 2025.】

item.title: 黎巴嫩总统就职，187%的债券涨幅再获推动
item.description: 新兴市场的货币经理们表示，即使黎巴嫩违约债券的价值在最近几个月几乎翻了三倍，现在抛售还为时过早，因为新总统的任命有可能为美元流动、改革和债务重组打开大门。【原文：Emerging-market money managers say it’s too early to sell Lebanon’s defaulted bonds even after they nearly tripled in value in recent months, as the appointment of a new president potentially opens the door for dollar flows, reforms and debt restructuring.】

item.title: 冬季风暴席卷美国南部，2,000 多架次航班停飞
item.description: 一场席卷美国南部的强大冬季风暴导致 2000 多架航班停飞、客运列车停运，并威胁到该地区的强降雪。【原文：A powerful winter storm sweeping the US South has grounded more than 2,000 flights, halted passenger trains and threatens the region with heavy snowfall.】
